message: And by "us" I mean us startup people. People that are interested in startups, making startups, etc
If there is one, I'd like to know. I'm on EFNet/freenode and I've talked to very very few people who I'd qualify as a "startup person"
Ya, everyone I talk to on here and HN is awesome. And then when I go around IRC channels I get not-so-startupy people.
maybe time to populate #yc on EFNet?
or even, #convore :)
Well, Leah's original idea for convore was realtime chat that wasn't irc (Doesn't have an inherent technical barrier to entry), so I wonder what making a channel would accomplish >_>
Someone should start a channel on freenode!
so a channel on IRC would be a good way to honor convore
@JohnFail yea he is kinda right with realtime, but she got the idea from using IRC and enjoying that so how would a channel not be a good idea to honor convore?
Because it's regressing on the idea

@italiano40 I'm feeling pretty sure that  @Aranjedeath is spot on:

http://blog.leahculver.com/2011/02/convore-group-chat-for-everyone.html
@Aranjedeath no actually Leah's original idea for convore was IRC, that was easier to use
I don't actually have any objection to it, and I'd probably join a channel if someone made it, I just wanted to point that out.
@rocel I've always been a fan of irssi.
btw best IRC client in my opinion is shell + screen + irssi
Convore dings on nickalerts I think, if you leave it open
( convore should have a setting to display only the messages then, the top and left bars would be useless in a instant messaging use)
hmm a #convore already exists there
hmm that clone1018 is a quassel (bnc type) client and it also has the #convore on efnet
There's no channel oper on Freenode, and freenode requires nick registration.. fail.
Although using Convore would be nice and whatever. I just prefer IRC for instant chat. Low bandwidth. I can always be on it. I don't know :|
what is 'the' best irc clients btw?
i can make a #convore on irc.freenode.net and have my bot relay it to convore
actually let me do that now ;]
I'd use Quassel. Its built on QT so it works on many platforms and its a bouncer like client.
i have a registered nick on freenode
ah more irssi fans around lol
@bthate I like that it's simple and doesn't have much overhead (so I don't care about leaving it running all the time), but you can still do a lot with it.
colloquy for Mac OSX is my irc client of choice a very nice one, and if the convore channel is open leave details so we can connect
Aww it doesn't make the whole thing clickable
you just need to msg the user "nickserv help" and you'll get info
just use this command /msg nickserv help
ok group #convore is now open to IRC users ;]
I'm not like op squatting or whatever. I enjoy Quassel though.
X-Chat, Bitchx and irssi are all good on *nix, Mirc and XChat-WDK on windows are also great. I have no idea about mac.
do you know any portable ones? made in java? ( i work on windows and linux computers) or with webinterface that I would install on my server?
irc://irc.freenode.net/convore
just look into the FAQ on freenode
hmmm i feel stupid ... how to create a account on freenode? ( i am an veeeeeery occasional irc user >.<' )
On freenode there is #startups.
It's a bit of a chilled IRC channel that jumps between random topics and web development/entrepreneurship.
www.webetalk.com is awesome.
4 YC founders so far actively use it.
I vouch for Webetalk, great place.
fo sho yeah
You guys know that #Startups on Freenode has been there for 2-3 years, and is mostly HN folk, right? ;)
@awfy - Isn't that what you'd want from an IRC room? ;)
@e1ven it's heavily packed though.
@e1ven personally, I'm a fan of the small community aspect when discussing things.
true and no one talks so your voice is totally going to be heard but i am in the startups channel and i mean you can really just jump in and talk i don't think it i so big that it is out of control
@awfy, why not just stick with convore then?
It can never hurt to be in two channels at once :)
#convore on irc.freenode.net has 8 people and a bot! I'd call that small :D
did anyone else get locked out the #convore on freenode? i need an invite who wants to hook me up?
yes got locked out too .. guess we have to wait for the irc.convore.com ..
I guess I should have used my bouncer
lets hope it wont be to long before irc.convore.com arrives ;]

I'm in channel, but its muted or something...
I'm on it, just can't type in it...
dont know what channel mode is causing it .. its the +i that makes it invite only ..
yeah i has todo with registered nicks only mode or something
guys i created a new channel on freenode, #convoreIRC and i have ops so yea
Flipped a coin: Tails
i just got in? wtf is going on with this now to put my bouncer on that channel LOL
Rolled four 20-sided dice: 13, 5, 12, 12 - Total: 42
/play rimshot
